{"step_by_step_thinking": "Coarctation of the aorta is a congenital heart condition characterized by a narrowing of the aorta. According to the documents, it is associated with Turner's syndrome (Document [20]), bicuspid aortic valve (Document [3]), and atresia of aortic arch (Document [21]). However, there is no mention of an association with pulmonary stenosis.", "answer_choice": "C. Pulmonary stenosis"}
